p: The Earth is a hub of more than 500,000 plant species, of which 10 % are utilized as food source and 10–15 % as source of drugs ( Borris, 1996). Since ancient times, phytomedicine of ethnic communities used to be the basic method of treatment in China ( Chang and But, 2014), India ( Dev, 1999), Africa and many other countries ( Schultes and Raffauf, 1990). Globally, a major proportion of the world’s populations rely on plant-based medications for primary health care and phytocompounds as ingredients of drugs ( Farnsworth, 1990).
